title: Weather Patterns and Climate

vocab.definition: The daily conditions of temperature, precipitation, wind, and humidity
The average weather patterns in a place over many years
The continuous movement of water between Earth's surface and the atmosphere
The boundary between two different air masses that creates weather changes

teachingNotes: Use weather maps and data collection. Create water cycle models. Discuss how geography affects climate patterns.
